channel.title: Favorite Game Console?
channel.description: I have to admit, my favorite game consoles are Xbox, Wii, and Playstation 2, but that's just me. Please vote for YOUR favorite game console!

item.title: Favorite Game Console?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Now people, don’t forget Kane is Australian. So, $900 AUD is the equivalent to $786 USD, €534 EUR, or just under £400 GBP. Don’t forget about tax/vat too.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Game Console?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:23, topic:167756”]The PS3’s are very ugly, and too pricey.
I know looks don’t count, but I’m not paying around $900 for a gaming console.

I like the Xbox 360 controllers better, as well.[/quote]
$900 console? its £250 here at the cheapest which is around $500. As for the looks its more of an opinion thing like when i had the xbox 360 it just felt to plastic-like and cheap.
Also, if you buy everything for the xbox 360 that the ps3 has built in - it will end up costing you more than the ps3

Like i said though, its all a matter of opinion mostly.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Game Console?
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“ThugLife, post:18, topic:167756”]Xbox at the moment has a better online services than the playstation 3, it is worth that money. However once playstation home comes out it will have everything and more than xbl has.
Since playstation home will include features into a real life situation type thing, like you can rent films on xbox live - on playstation home you will be able to go to rental stores as you would in real life and rent them through that.

Sony really did fuck up on the launch, if they gave game developers what they needed well in advanced to the launch of the system game developers would of had time to fully get the hang of the blueray system, and release the best games graphically, detail and size wise.
Also if sony planned the packages of the playstation right, looked at sales stats of the wii and xbox 360 learned off them they could of released it and kept, probably even beat/tie up with the xbox 360 sales in a short time.

Since what i have found out the main reasons to why not many people bought the ps3 are not to actually do with the system its self, its to do with things that if it was all planned could of been avoided.

Now, with that in mind i do not want to see any fucking arguments over what is better simply because it is a silly and argument fueled by jealous kids.[/quote]

finally someone explained that to me alright now i know why

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Game Console?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Xbox at the moment has a better online services than the playstation 3, it is worth that money. However once playstation home comes out it will have everything and more than xbl has.
Since playstation home will include features into a real life situation type thing, like you can rent films on xbox live - on playstation home you will be able to go to rental stores as you would in real life and rent them through that.

Sony really did fuck up on the launch, if they gave game developers what they needed well in advanced to the launch of the system game developers would of had time to fully get the hang of the blueray system, and release the best games graphically, detail and size wise.
Also if sony planned the packages of the playstation right, looked at sales stats of the wii and xbox 360 learned off them they could of released it and kept, probably even beat/tie up with the xbox 360 sales in a short time.

Since what i have found out the main reasons to why not many people bought the ps3 are not to actually do with the system its self, its to do with things that if it was all planned could of been avoided.

Now, with that in mind i do not want to see any fucking arguments over what is better simply because it is a silly and argument fueled by jealous kids.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Game Console?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I voted Wii. Although it’s not the only thing with backwards compatibility, you can buy games for the Virtual console, or use your GameCube games, and although the quality of some of the starting games were crap, there are plans for more games coming up.

Although the Wii internet browser is a load of crap and costs money now, and the fact some future upgrades won’t be available for older consoles(such as DVD playback), I’d still prefer fun to graphics.

Read full topic

So I’m going with the first one I ever got, NES.

-Mh
